result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Contrell Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC; balance paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: - Full-time work, school or a combination.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- NO CONTACT with D.P.
- No further violations of the law.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Contrell Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Edward Contrell Thomas.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Restitution hearing. Defendant's appearance waived. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the Courts, and requested an adjournment.  State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned, branch 2. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Restitution hearing scheduled for 10-14-2022 at 10:30 am, Branch 2.
Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (37 pages) commencing 06-09-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years, credit for 162 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 3 years, the term of extended supervision is 3 years. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with D.P. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA,  out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Edward Contrell Thomas not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement
Received and Filed. Defendant's Notice of Right to Appeal
Received and Filed. Defendant's Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Edward Contrell Thomas not in court, in custody, appearance waived.   Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter is adjourned in BR 2 for an in person plea and sentencing hearing.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in court by video with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs who appears in person.  Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Matte. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defense Counsel is in another court on another matter; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with D.P. and G.R.  State to submit written no contact order at the next court date.

Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Edward Contrell Thomas in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
